titleStmt.author: Hawkins, Thomas

monogr.title: Bosvvorth-field : with a taste of the variety of other poems, left by Sir Iohn Beaumont, Baronet, deceased: set forth by his sonne, Sir Iohn Beaumont, Baronet; and dedicated to the Kings most Excellent Maiestie
monogr.author: Beaumont, John

div.head: To the worthy Muse of his Noble Friend, Sir Iohn Beaumont, Knight Baronet.

lg.l: WE doe not vsher forth thy Verse with these,
That thine may by our prayse the better please:
That were impertinent, and we too weake,
To adde a grace, where eu'ry line doth speake,
And sweetly Eccho out in this rich store,
All we can any way pretend, and more.
Yet since we stand engag'd, we this make knowne,
Thy Layes are vnaffected; Free; Thine owne;
Muse most Emphaticall; and Wit, Diuine.
